description: Secrétaire à abattant; Martin Carlin (French, born Germany, about 1730 - 1785, master 1766), Circular plaque painted by Jean-Jacques Pierre le jeune (French, about 1745 - about 1800), Two frieze and two spandrel plaques painted by Claude Couturier (French, died 1775, active 1762 - 1775), et al; Paris, France; 1775; Oak veneered w/ebony, holly, stained holly, amaranth and tulipwood, incised w/colored mastics, set w/soft-paste porcelain plaques w/bleu céleste ground color, polychrome enamel and gilding; gilt-bronze mounts; white marble top; 120 × 94 × 34 cm (47 1/4 × 37 × 13 3/8 in.); 65.DA.2; Gift of J. Paul Getty; J. Paul Getty Museum, Los Angeles, California
